FuncDef:
The senderid-tlv-type command configures the type of the sender ID TLV in a CFM packet.
The undo senderid-tlv-type command restores the default type of the sender ID TLV in a CFM packet.
By default, the type of the sender ID TLV is defer.
CLIs: senderid-tlv-type { chassis | chassis-manage | defer | manage | none }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that a CFM packet contains the chassis ID.
-

Indicates that a CFM packet contains the chassis ID and management address.
-

Indicates that the content of the sender ID TLV is determined by the MD object.
-

Indicates that a CFM packet contains the management address.
-

Indicates that a CFM packet does not contain the type of the sender ID TLV.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The senderid-tlv-type command can be used only on the device running IEEE Standard 802.1ag-2007.
You can run the senderid-tlv-type command to configure the type of the sender ID TLV in a CFM packet in the default MD view.
Prerequisites
Run cfm md command to create an MD.
